symptoms: dyspnea with normal pulmonary function tests

diagnoses.name: Kounis Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A type of allergic acute coronary syndrome. It is a confluence of acute coronary syndromes with conditions associated with mast cell activation, including allergic or hypersensitivity reactions as well as anaphylactic or anaphylactoid events.

diagnoses.name: Anemia
diagnoses.description: A condition in which the blood doesn't have enough healthy red blood cells or hemoglobin, leading to a reduced capacity of the blood to carry oxygen to the body's tissues, potentially causing weakness and fatigue.

diagnoses.name: Cardiovascular Disease
diagnoses.description: A class of diseases that involve the heart or blood vessels. Dyslipidemia (abnormal lipid levels) is a significant risk factor. Symptoms and conditions such as Kounis syndrome and presyncope can be related to underlying cardiovascular issues.

diagnoses.name: Mast Cell Activation Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A condition in which mast cells inappropriately release chemical mediators, resulting in a wide range of chronic symptoms, some of which can include Kounis syndrome. It can be associated with allergic reactions and anaphylaxis.

diagnoses.name: Hypersensitivity Reaction
diagnoses.description: An exaggerated response by the immune system to a drug or other substance, which can cause a variety of symptoms including those seen in Kounis syndrome. Basophilia can be a part of this reaction.

diagnoses.name: Chronic Myeloid Leukemia
diagnoses.description: A type of cancer that starts in certain blood-forming cells of the bone marrow. It can lead to an increased number of basophils and can have an indirect relationship with symptoms such as anemia.

diagnoses.name: Hemolytic Anemia
diagnoses.description: Anemia caused by rapid destruction of red blood cells, which can lead to symptoms such as presyncope. It can also occur in a context where there's an abnormal immune response, potentially linking with Kounis syndrome.

diagnoses.name: Polycythemia Vera
diagnoses.description: A blood disorder in which your bone marrow makes too many red blood cells. It can cause an increased risk of blood clots, leading to symptoms like presyncope. Though not directly causing basophilia, it affects the overall cell count balance.

diagnoses.name: Metabolic Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A cluster of conditions that increase the risk of heart disease, stroke, and diabetes. These conditions include increased blood pressure, high blood sugar, excess body fat around the waist, and abnormal cholesterol or triglyceride levels (such as dyslipidemia).

diagnoses.name: Hypereosinophilic Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A group of blood disorders characterized by an overproduction of eosinophils (another type of white blood cell). Although not specifically involving basophils, it can present with similar systemic symptoms and allergic reactions, potentially impacting conditions like Kounis syndrome.

diagnoses: Hashimoto's Thyroiditis leading to transient Hyperthyroidism

diagnoses.name: Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia (HHT)
diagnoses.explanation: Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia, also known as Osler-Weber-Rendu Disease, is a genetic disorder that affects blood vessels and can lead to abnormal bleeding.

diagnoses.name: Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis
diagnoses.explanation: Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis is an uncommon disorder that causes inflammation of the blood vessels in your nose, sinuses, throat, lungs, and kidneys.

diagnoses.name: Churg-Strauss Syndrome
diagnoses.explanation: Churg-Strauss Syndrome is a rare systemic vasculitis that causes inflammation of small to medium-sized blood vessels.

diagnoses.name: Marfan Syndrome
diagnoses.explanation: Marfan Syndrome is a genetic disorder that affects the body’s connective tissue, and can affect the heart, eyes, blood vessels, and skeleton.

diagnoses.name: Cardiac Arrhythmia
diagnoses.explanation: Cardiac Arrhythmia refers to irregular heartbeats, which can cause palpitations, and may be benign or life-threatening.

diagnoses.name: Otitis Externa
diagnoses.explanation: Otitis Externa, also known as swimmer’s ear, is an inflammation of the outer ear and ear canal.

diagnoses.name: Nasal Polyps
diagnoses.explanation: Nasal Polyps are painless soft growths inside your nose or sinuses that can cause congestion.

diagnoses.name: Rheumatic Heart Disease
diagnoses.explanation: Rheumatic Heart Disease is a condition in which the heart valves have been permanently damaged by rheumatic fever.

diagnoses.name: Allergic Rhinitis
diagnoses.explanation: Allergic Rhinitis is an allergic response causing an itchy, runny nose, sneezing, and nasal congestion.

diagnoses.name: Hypertension
diagnoses.explanation: Hypertension, or high blood pressure, can cause secondary symptoms such as palpitations due to increased heart workload.

symptoms: dyspnea with normal pulmonary function tests
diagnoses: Vitamin Deficiencies (e.g., Vitamin B12, Folate Deficiency)

diagnoses.name: Migraine with aura
diagnoses.description: A type of headache characterized by visual disturbances and other aura symptoms followed by a severe headache, often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and sensitivity to light and sound.

diagnoses.name: Migraine without aura
diagnoses.description: A type of headache that manifests as a painful, pulsating headache, often on one side of the head, accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and extreme sensitivity to light and sound but without the visual disturbances of an aura.

diagnoses.name: Cluster headache
diagnoses.description: Intensely painful headaches occurring in clusters or cyclical patterns, often waking the patient in the middle of the night with severe pain in or around one eye on one side of the head.

diagnoses.name: Tension-type headache
diagnoses.description: A common type of headache characterized by a dull, aching sensation all over the head rather than the pulsating pain of migraines. It's often compared to the sensation of having a tight band around the forehead.

diagnoses.name: Medication-overuse headache
diagnoses.description: Headaches occurring from the overuse of headache medication, which can aggravate headache symptoms and lead to a cycle of pain and medication overuse.

diagnoses.name: Viral Meningitis
diagnoses.description: An infection of the membranes and fluid surrounding your brain and spinal cord. Symptoms may include headache, fever, neck stiffness, sensitivity to light, and weakness.

diagnoses.name: Subarachnoid hemorrhage
diagnoses.description: A condition caused by bleeding in the space surrounding the brain. It can cause a sudden, severe headache, along with stiffness of the neck, photophobia, and altered mental status.

diagnoses.name: Encephalitis
diagnoses.description: An inflammation of the brain, caused by infection or an autoimmune response. Symptoms can include headache, fever, confusion, drowsiness, and, in severe cases, seizures and weakness.

diagnoses.name: Idiopathic intracranial hypertension
diagnoses.description: A condition characterized by increased pressure inside the skull without a detectable cause. Symptoms include headache, vision problems, nausea, and pulsatile tinnitus.

diagnoses.name: Panhypopituitarism
diagnoses.description: A rare condition in which the body produces lower amounts of its hormones due to an issue with the pituitary gland. Symptoms can include weakness, fatigue, sensitivity to cold, and headaches.

diagnoses: Poisoning (e.g., heavy metal poisoning, medication overdose)
Hepatitis B or C with cryoglobulinemia
Drug Reaction with Eosinophilia and Systemic Symptoms (DRESS) Syndrome
Chronic Hepatitis B or C infection with associated vasculitis
Paraneoplastic Syndromes associated with hematologic malignancies
Viral infections (e.g., Hepatitis B, Hepatitis C, Parvovirus, COVID-19)
Viral infections causing rash and encephalitis
Drug Reaction with Eosinophilia and Systemic Symptoms (DRESS) Syndrome
Evans Syndrome (Autoimmune Hemolytic Anemia with Immune Thrombocytopenia)

diagnoses.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)
diagnoses.description: A chronic autoimmune disease that can affect multiple systems including the skin, joints, and internal organs. Its symptoms go along with thrombocytopenia, oral ulcers, and arthropathy.

diagnoses.name: Rheumatoid Arthritis
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disorder that primarily affects joints but can also cause thrombocytopenia and oral ulcers as part of its wide range of systemic symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Mixed Connective Tissue Disease (MCTD)
diagnoses.description: A rare autoimmune disorder characterized by features commonly seen in lupus, scleroderma, polymyositis, and sometimes rheumatoid arthritis, including arthropathy and oral ulcers.

diagnoses.name: Sjögren's Syndrome
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disease that attacks the glands that provide lubrication to the eyes and mouth. It can lead to oral ulcers and is associated with various rheumatologic conditions, including arthropathy.

diagnoses.name: Behçet's Disease
diagnoses.description: A rare disorder causing blood vessel inflammation throughout the body. Symptoms include oral ulcers, skin rashes, and can sometimes present with thrombocytopenia.

diagnoses.name: Psoriatic Arthritis
diagnoses.description: An inflammatory form of arthritis associated with psoriasis, which might exhibit features like lichen planus. It might also present with thrombocytopenia in severe cases.

diagnoses.name: Lichen Planus
diagnoses.description: A chronic inflammatory condition affecting the skin and mucous membranes, including the oral mucosa. When associated with arthropathy, it might suggest an underlying systemic condition.

diagnoses.name: Idiopathic Thrombocytopenic Purpura (ITP)
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disorder that can lead to easy or excessive bruising and bleeding, resulting from unusually low levels of platelets. It is primarily diagnosed when other conditions have been excluded.

diagnoses.name: Evan's Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A rare autoimmune disorder characterized by the combination of immune thrombocytopenia (ITP) and autoimmune hemolytic anemia (AIHA), occasionally associated with other autoimmune phenomena.

diagnoses.name: Graft-versus-host disease (GVHD)
diagnoses.description: A condition that occurs when donor bone marrow or stem cells attack the recipient. Symptoms can include thrombocytopenia, oral ulcers, skin rash closely resembling lichen planus, and arthropathy.
